title: Fort Larned National Historic Site: Living History
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Living History              Living History         Living historians interact with visitors at the Commissary. NPS  During special events, and as staffing allows the rest of the year, staff and volunteers dressed in period clothing may be found throughout the fort. These living historians can offer insight into the lives of the people who lived and worked at Fort Larned in its heyday. You might find living history characters in the infantry barracks, hospital, blacksmith shop, blockhouse, sentry post, school room, commissary, arsenal, quartermaster storehouse, issue room, officers' quarters, or marching around the fort! Living history demonstrations include blacksmithing, historic weapons demonstrations, games, quilting and sewing, cooking, wood and leather working, baking, and more. If you would like to participate as a living historian, see the Volunteer page.
